resources.string: In our town, you will find accommodations ranging from 35000 COP to luxurious cabins equipped with all the elements to promote a restorative rest.

Due to La Guajira department integrating flavours from different parts of the world and the variety of local ingredients for its cuisine, it can be ensured that visitors will fall in love with Guajiras culinary delights.

The stillness of the blue and clear skies of the Guajira peninsula, desert area of northeastern Colombia, is interrupted by bright pink flowers that dissolve in spirals over the lagoons of the Los Flamencos Flora and Fauna Sanctuary.

Diseñador gráco, animador 3D y actualmente en proceso de formación como Técnico en Desarrollo de Software. Combino la creatividad visual con conocimientos técnicos para crear experiencias únicas. Mi perl abarca desde el
diseño gráco hasta la programación, destacán- dome en el área de desarrollo Front end. Poseo
competencias laborales de dinamismo, creativi- dad y atención al detalle, fundamentales para
impulsar proyectos hacia el siguiente nivel.

"According to oral tradition, Manaure owes its name to the radiance of a high-born indigenous individual who bequeathed his name to this geographical site. According to research, indeed, in the neighboring Republic of Venezuela, there was an indigenous chief of the Caquetío tribe with much prestige who went by the name of Manaure. Initially, this indigenous person was very friendly with the conquistadors and the evangelizers, but later he confronted the Spaniards and in 1821 was assassinated by Morillos army.
The Municipality of Manaure was created by ordinance 015 of 1973, which began to take effect on October 1, 1974. This date is institutionalized to celebrate Manaures anniversary. This ordinance project was presented by Manaures son and deputy, Manuel Mengual Meza, and was sanctioned by Dr. Benjamín Armenta López, Governor of the Department of La Guajira.
